Reason: The 'cached_rows_warn_threshold' configuration in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the caching mechanism of rows in the system. A change in the value of this configuration can significantly affect the memory consumption and overall performance of the system, as it determines when a warning should be issued for cached rows. Therefore, any notable variations in this configuration can lead to noticeable differences in execution time and memory usage, making it a performance-sensitive parameter.
